events.description: The release of the composite Purchasing Managers' Index for Italy's private sector for January 2026.

facts.fact_text: The HCOB Italy Composite PMI rose to 51.4 in January 2026 from 50.3 in December.

evidences.evidence_text: The HCOB Italy Composite PMI rose to 51.4 in January 2026 from 50.3 in December

facts.fact_text: Private sector employment increased in both the services and manufacturing sectors.

evidences.evidence_text: Private sector employment edged higher, with both services and manufacturing adding staff

facts.fact_text: Service providers increased their charges at the fastest rate in six months.

evidences.evidence_text: service providers raised charges at the fastest pace in six months

claims.claim_text: Italy's private sector has regained momentum.
claims.author: HCOB

claims.claim_text: The expansion in the private sector is considered modest.
claims.author: HCOB

evidences.evidence_text: still only a modest expansion in the private sector

claims.claim_text: Service sector firms have cautious expectations for growth in the coming months.
claims.author: service sector firms

evidences.evidence_text: service sector firms expressing more cautious expectations for growth in the months ahead

evidence.evidence_text: Growth was led by the services sector, which recorded a stronger rise in activity
input costs rose, particularly for manufacturers, driving overall price pressures higher
Private sector employment edged higher, with both services and manufacturing adding staff
